Author: thatnextquote

Comment: While I am grateful some work is being done, I am afraid they are making this too focused a one individual to the detriment of other innocent people sent there. Like others have said, Andry Hernandez Romero (often referred to as the hairdresser) has no business at all being at CECOT, or even being deported as he was in the middle of a legal asylum application process. And I know there are other similar cases too in the 100s that were sent there. This singular focus, while I’m grateful it exists at all, feels concerningly bandwagon. Suppose Kilmer is released, I don’t want our democratic reps to say case closed, pat themselves on the back, and leave innocent people to die forgotten in a supermax.

Author: irrelevantanonymous

Comment: They need to expand this focus on more people. Make it clear that Kilmar is not a one off situation, he just happened to get a clear admission to the Supreme Court that he was a mistake. Andrys does not deserve to be in that prison. He was escaping persecution to come to America and contributing to society. He should be in America, but if you are going to insist on being cruel and draconian, at least do it legally and send him back as a free man.
